test_cases.test_name: Environmental Monitoring System - Temperature Accuracy Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS accurately measures and records temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.
prerequisites: Test environment with controlled temperature conditions

test_steps.action: Set up the reference temperature probe adjacent to the EMS sensor in a controlled environment.
test_steps.expected_result: Both probes are properly positioned for simultaneous temperature measurement.

test_steps.action: Stabilize the test environment at -80°C and record readings from both probes.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS reading matches reference probe within ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Repeat measurements at 0°C, +25°C, and +50°C.
test_steps.expected_result: All EMS readings remain within ±0.5°C of reference values.
data_to_capture: Temperature readings at each test point

acceptance_criteria: All temperature measurements fall within ±0.5°C of reference values
System maintains accuracy across the full specified range
data_integrity_requirements: All test data must be automatically recorded in the system's audit trail
No manual data entry allowed for test results

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS correctly generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint as specified in URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C in the EMS configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts and stores the setpoint value.

test_steps.action: Gradually increase chamber temperature to 26.9°C and monitor for alerts.
test_steps.expected_result: No alert generated below +2°C deviation threshold.

test_steps.action: Increase temperature to 27.1°C and verify alert generation.
test_steps.expected_result: System generates audible/visual alert within 1 minute of threshold breach.

test_steps.action: Repeat test for -2°C deviation scenario.
test_steps.expected_result: Alert generated when temperature drops below 23°C.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts generated precisely at ±2°C deviation points
Alert notifications are clearly visible/audible
Alert events recorded in system audit trail
data_integrity_requirements: Alert events must be timestamped and non-modifiable
Alert history must be retained per retention policy

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) continuously monitors temperature as per URS-EMS-001 and URS-EMS-002.
prerequisites: Test environment set up with controlled temperature

test_steps.action: Set the temperature in the test environment to 25°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature reading of 25°C ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Gradually increase the temperature to 30°C over 10 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS continuously updates temperature readings every 5 minutes.

test_steps.action: Verify that the system generates an alert when temperature exceeds 27°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert as per URS-EMS-005.

acceptance_criteria: EMS continuously monitors temperature within ±0.5°C accuracy.
Temperature readings are recorded at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.
System generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint.
data_integrity_requirements: All temperature readings must be stored in the vendor's standard database format.
Audit trail must be maintained for all temperature readings.

test_cases.test_name: Verify Audit Trail Functionality in EMS
test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS maintains an audit trail as per URS-EMS-008.

test_steps.action: Log in to the EMS using a test user account.
test_steps.expected_result: System records login event in the audit trail.
data_to_capture: Audit trail entry for login event

test_steps.action: Change the temperature setpoint from 25°C to 30°C.
test_steps.expected_result: System records setpoint change in the audit trail.
data_to_capture: Audit trail entry for setpoint change

test_steps.action: Log out of the EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: System records logout event in the audit trail.
data_to_capture: Audit trail entry for logout event

acceptance_criteria: All user actions (login, setpoint change, logout) are recorded in the audit trail.
Audit trail entries include timestamp, user ID, and action details.
data_integrity_requirements: Audit trail must be tamper-proof and time-stamped.
Audit trail entries must include all required metadata.

test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System accurately records temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.
prerequisites: Test environment prepared with controlled temperature conditions

test_steps.action: Set up the EMS to monitor a controlled environment at 25°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature reading within 24.5°C to 25.5°C.

test_steps.action: Gradually decrease the environment temperature to -80°C and record EMS readings at 10°C intervals.
test_steps.expected_result: All EMS readings remain within ±0.5°C of reference device readings.

test_steps.action: Repeat the process increasing temperature to +50°C.
test_steps.expected_result: All EMS readings remain within ±0.5°C of reference device readings.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of reference values
System must maintain accuracy across entire operational range
data_integrity_requirements: All test data must be automatically recorded in the EMS database
No manual data entries permitted during testing

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS correctly generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint and that these alerts are properly logged.

test_steps.action: Set the EMS temperature setpoint to 25°C and enable monitoring.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays stable temperature reading at setpoint.

test_steps.action: Increase environment temperature to 27.1°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates high temperature alert within 1 minute of crossing 27°C threshold.

test_steps.action: Decrease environment temperature to 22.9°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates low temperature alert within 1 minute of crossing 23°C threshold.

test_steps.action: Verify alert appears in system audit trail.
test_steps.expected_result: All alerts are properly recorded in audit trail with timestamp and alert details.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts must be generated within 1 minute of threshold crossing
All alerts must be recorded in audit trail
Alert notifications must be clearly visible to operators
data_integrity_requirements: Alert records must be immutable once logged
Audit trail must capture all alert events

test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System accurately records temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.
prerequisites: Test environment with controlled temperature conditions

test_steps.action: Set up the EMS in a controlled environment with a known temperature reference.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS initializes and displays current temperature reading.

test_steps.action: Adjust the environment temperature to -80°C using the reference device.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS records temperature within ±0.5°C of the reference value.

test_steps.action: Repeat the test at +50°C and two intermediate points (e.g., -20°C and +25°C).
test_steps.expected_result: All temperature readings are within the specified accuracy range.
data_to_capture: Recorded temperatures at all test points

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the reference values.
System must maintain continuous recording without data gaps.
regulatory_basis: EU GMP Annex 11 for computerized systems
data_integrity_requirements: Temperature data must be complete, consistent, and accurate
Audit trail must record all temperature measurements
urs_requirements: URS-EMS-004: Temperature range and accuracy requirements

test_cases.objective: Validate that the Chromatography Data System correctly generates custom reports with configured calculations and formatting.

test_steps.action: Load test chromatographic data into the CDS.
test_steps.expected_result: Data is successfully loaded and displayed in the system.

test_steps.action: Execute the custom report generation for the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: Report is generated without errors using the configured template.

test_steps.action: Verify all configured calculations (impurity calculations, RRF adjustments) in the report.
test_steps.expected_result: All calculations are performed correctly according to the configured formulas.

test_steps.action: Check report formatting and data presentation.
test_steps.expected_result: Report follows all configured formatting rules and naming conventions.

acceptance_criteria: All configured calculations must produce accurate results
Report formatting must match the approved template
System must maintain data integrity throughout the reporting process
regulatory_basis: ICH Q2(R1) for analytical method validation
data_integrity_requirements: Original chromatographic data must remain unchanged
All report calculations must be traceable to source data
Audit trail must record report generation events

test_cases.test_name: Environmental Monitoring System Temperature Accuracy Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) accurately measures temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature reference device to -80°C and place it in the monitored area.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within -80.5°C to -79.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature reference device to +50°C and place it in the monitored area.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature within +49.5°C to +50.5°C.

acceptance_criteria: EMS temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the reference device readings
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are recorded and stored accurately

test_cases.test_name: EMS Alert Generation for Temperature Deviations
test_cases.objective: Verify that the Environmental Monitoring System (EMS) generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C and wait for the system to stabilize.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature at 25°C.

test_steps.action: Increase the temperature to 27.1°C using the reference device.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for temperature deviation.

test_steps.action: Decrease the temperature to 22.9°C using the reference device.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for temperature deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS must generate alerts within 5 minutes of temperature deviation
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alerts are logged and timestamped accurately
